Comment: Hi all! This is a game I recently played in a mini tournament. I have kept my opponents name anonymous.

Preparing ...Bg7, but if he does that, I'll execute my master plan...
Phase one of my plan.
Excellent. Now for phase two.
Phase Two: Align the queen with the bishop to prepare for Bh6.
Even better. Now, if my plan works, I will have a perfect mating net.
Phase Three: Purposing a bishop trade. 9. ...Bxh6 10. Qxh6 and the king is trapped in my web! Right now, black should just ignore my last move and maybe get his queen active.
Black threatens my bishop. He ignores my h bishop... for now...
Not the best, but at least I get something.
Now black takes the bait!
My queen is in perfect position.
Now, if black's knight moves anywhere, it's checkmate Qxh7. My next couple moves would probably be 13. f4, exf4 (hopefully) 14.Rxf4, threatening the knight and checkmate

And that's the game, folks. Hasta La Vista.
